Posts.Content: janmarie wrote: Hi,  I know second opinions have been addressed before but I cann't remember the requirements (chemo brain)?  Anyway after six months of Abraxane, Avastin and Aridia, I am ready for a second opinion.  My insurance will pay for this I just have to get myself there.  We just had a CAT scan which showed slight increase in the size of my liver mets.  My ONC ordered my first PET scan for next thursday and consult with him on Monday the 21st.  For now we are staying the course of chemo.  Sloan Kettering and MD Anderson seem to be mentioned a lot on this site but I think I remember something about not being on any treatment before they will see me.  If anybody can recommend a particular doctor or how to go about this I would really appreciate it.  I am in Washington so Seattle is also an option.  Thanks a million and good luck to all, Jan  Dx 1/16/2008, Stage IV, 1/13 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2008 03:36AM janmarie wrote: hi,  I was also just diagnosed with bone mets.  When my doctor suspected the bone mets he had an MRI and cat scan done which also show mets to my liver.  Because the bone is so hard to get a good sample they biopsied my liver to confirm metastatic breast cancer.  I had my first chemo today Avistin and Abraxane.  Good luck and keep us posted.
